titleStmt.title: An humble remonstrance from his Excellency Sir Thomas Fairfax: concerning the great sufferings and grievances of divers, whose cases are represented to the Parliament. Read in the House of Commons. the 14. day of September 1647. Die Martis, Septem. 14. 1647. Ordered by the Commons in Parliament assembled, that this businesse be referred to the consideration, and examination of the Committee of Indemnity, to relieve them as they shall see cause, if they have power, otherwayes to make speedy report to the House. H. Elsynge Cler. Par, Dom, Com.
titleStmt.author: Fairfax, Thomas Fairfax, Baron, 1612-1671.
England and Wales. Parliament. House of Commons.

titleStmt.title: An humble remonstrance from his Excellency Sir Thomas Fairfax: concerning the great sufferings and grievances of divers, whose cases are represented to the Parliament. Read in the House of Commons. the 14. day of September 1647. Die Martis, Septem. 14. 1647. Ordered by the Commons in Parliament assembled, that this businesse be referred to the consideration, and examination of the Committee of Indemnity, to relieve them as they shall see cause, if they have power, otherwayes to make speedy report to the House. H. Elsynge Cler. Par, Dom, Com.
titleStmt.author: Fairfax, Thomas Fairfax, Baron, 1612-1671.
England and Wales. Parliament. House of Commons.

publicationStmt.publisher: by Robert Ibbitson, and are to be sold at his house in Smithfield,

notesStmt.note: Regarding the cases of James Simball, Francis Wade, Robert White, and Roger Crabb, imprisoned for sedition.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
